<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Po</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight">erT, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IntBits, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PtrTraits&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">PointerIntPairInfo;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// PointerIntPair - This class implements a pair of a pointer and small</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// integer.  It is designed to represent this in the space required by one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// pointer by bitmangling the integer into the low part of the pointer.  This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// can only be done for small integers: typically up to 3 bits, but it depends</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// on the number of bits available according to PointerLikeTypeTraits for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that PointerIntPair always puts the IntVal part in the highest bits</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// possible.  For example, PointerIntPair&lt;void&#42;, 1, bool&gt; will put the bit for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the bool into bit #2, not bit #0, which allows the low two bits to be used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for something else.  For example, this allows:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   PointerIntPair&lt;PointerIntPair&lt;void&#42;, 1, bool&gt;, 1, bool&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ... and the two bools will land in different bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a41f670c80fbc831d70a472b03c4739ae">PointerTy</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IntBits, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IntType = unsigned,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PtrTraits = PointerLikeTypeTraits&lt;PointerTy&gt;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/cseinfo-cpp/#a75f8a8519c2c9b30e7c06dc5e256fffa">Info</a> = PointerIntPairInfo&lt;PointerTy, IntBits, PtrTraits&gt;&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerintpair"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerintpair/#a7ad48fb0630d5c2580d123f11e76e885">PointerIntPair</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Used by MSVC visualizer and generally helpful for debugging/visualizing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">InfoTy = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/cseinfo-cpp/#a75f8a8519c2c9b30e7c06dc5e256fffa">Info</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/punnedpointer">detail::PunnedPointer&lt;PointerTy&gt;</a> Value;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;assert</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(PtrTraits::NumLowBitsAvailable &lt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    std::numeric&#95;limits&lt;uintptr&#95;t&gt;::digits,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;assert</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(IntBits &lt;= PtrTraits::NumLowBitsAvailable,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointerintpairinfo/#a753cd347a2578a1d1a4c3a6141c238f4"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointerintpairinfo/#a753cd347a2578a1d1a4c3a6141c238f4">MaskAndShiftConstants</a> : uintptr&#95;t &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// PointerBitMask - The bits that come from the pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointerintpairinfo/#a753cd347a2578a1d1a4c3a6141c238f4a3a51956fad564a5f8c9a923b17963cfa"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointerintpairinfo/#a753cd347a2578a1d1a4c3a6141c238f4a3a51956fad564a5f8c9a923b17963cfa">PointerBitMask</a> =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlight">        ~(uintptr&#95;t)(((intptr&#95;t)1 &lt;&lt; PtrTraits::NumLowBitsAvailable) - 1),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// IntShift - The number of low bits that we reserve for other uses, and</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointerintpairinfo/#a753cd347a2578a1d1a4c3a6141c238f4a1dd9e7252764042009f043bb2a8ad5f7"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointerintpairinfo/#a753cd347a2578a1d1a4c3a6141c238f4a1dd9e7252764042009f043bb2a8ad5f7">IntShift</a> = (uintptr&#95;t)PtrTraits::NumLowBitsAvailable - IntBits,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// IntMask - This is the unshifted mask for valid bits of the int type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointerintpairinfo/#a753cd347a2578a1d1a4c3a6141c238f4aadb9eb34960575d9dd59b4b765c1fd25"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointerintpairinfo/#a753cd347a2578a1d1a4c3a6141c238f4aadb9eb34960575d9dd59b4b765c1fd25">IntMask</a> = (uintptr&#95;t)(((intptr&#95;t)1 &lt;&lt; IntBits) - 1),</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ShiftedIntMask - This is the bits for the integer shifted in place.</span></CodeLine>
